response_requirements.initial_response_description: No specific statutory deadline; agencies must respond within reasonable period. Courts and AG guidance suggest good faith effort typically means responding within reasonable timeframe, commonly interpreted as approximately 30 business days for standard requests
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Reasonableness varies based on type, volume, and complexity of request
response_requirements.good_faith_standard: Agencies must make good faith effort to respond promptly; reasonable time varies by circumstances

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge for extensive use of information technology resources or extensive clerical/supervisory assistance
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Up to $0.15 per one-sided copy for documents 14 inches or less; actual cost for larger or special format
fee_structure.electronic_fee: Actual cost; electronic access preferred to reduce costs

exemptions.description: Trade secrets as defined in Florida law
Criminal investigation information and active criminal intelligence
Identity of victims of crimes, particularly sexual offenses and child abuse
Security system plans, vulnerability assessments, and security information
Personal identifying information including social security numbers, bank account numbers, credit card information
Home addresses, telephone numbers, photographs, and social security numbers of employees

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No formal administrative appeal process; Attorney General offers voluntary mediation services
appeal_process.second_level_notes: Direct court action via mandamus, declaratory judgment, or civil lawsuit; primary enforcement mechanism
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney fees and costs to prevailing party

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No requirement to state purpose or provide identification
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: May request by phone, in writing, or in person; no specific form required

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Each agency designates public records custodians
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must permit inspection under reasonable conditions; electronic access preferred when feasible
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Law must be liberally interpreted favoring disclosure
agency_obligations.redaction_required: Must redact only exempt portions and provide access to remainder

oversight_body.name: Florida Attorney General
oversight_body.role: Provides mediation services and guidance; no binding administrative appeal authority
oversight_body.contact_info: Office of the Attorney General, Open Government Mediation

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified from official Florida statutes. No specific response deadline in statute - good faith/reasonable time standard. Ground truth indicates 30 business days as commonly accepted reasonable period. Copying fees up to $0.15/page. May charge for extensive research. No formal administrative appeal process - Attorney General mediation available but not binding. Primary enforcement through civil lawsuits. Constitutional right established in Article I, Section 24. Liberal construction favoring disclosure.
